Developer API

Welcome to the Games Universe API! Our API allows you to programmatically access our platform's features, including game search, our AI assistant, and game submission.

Getting Started

To get started, you will need an API key. You can use the following test key for now:

test-api-key

You must include your API key in the X-API-Key header of your requests.

API Endpoints

Game Search API

Endpoint: GET /api/games/search

Description: Search for games by name or category. The response now includes richer data for each game.

Query Parameters:

  • q (string, optional): The search query. If not provided, all games will be returned.

Example Request:

curl -X GET "http://localhost:8000/api/games/search?q=AI" -H "X-API-Key: test-api-key"

Example Response:

[
    {
        "name": "AI MMO Adventure",
        "category": "AI MMO Games",
        "link": "ai_mmo_games.html",
        "description": "An open-world adventure powered by a dynamic AI storyteller.",
        "rating": 4.5,
        "player_count": 12000
    }
]

AI Assistant API

Endpoint: POST /api/ai/chat

Description: Get a response from our advanced AI assistant. You can ask for game ideas, code snippets, and more.

Request Body:

{
    "message": "Give me a game idea"
}

Example Request:

curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/api/ai/chat" -H "X-API-Key: test-api-key" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"message": "Give me a game idea"}'

Example Response:

{
    "response": "How about a puzzle game where you play as a time-traveling detective who has to solve crimes by manipulating events in the past? Each level could be a different case with unique paradoxes to resolve."
}

Game Submission API

Manage your games on the platform with the following endpoints:

  • Create Game: POST /api/games
  • Update Game: PUT /api/games/{game_name}
  • Delete Game: DELETE /api/games/{game_name}

See the API reference for more details on the request and response formats for these endpoints.

Play High-End Games Anywhere with Cloud Streaming

Our vision for Game Portal includes a Cloud Game Streaming feature, allowing you to play demanding PC and console games on various devices, streamed directly from powerful cloud servers.

Please Note: This feature is currently in the planning and conceptual phase and is NOT yet functional. Implementation would likely involve partnerships with existing cloud gaming providers.

How Cloud Gaming Works (Conceptual)

Instead of running games on your local device, cloud gaming services run the game on high-performance servers in data centers. The game's video and audio are streamed to your device like a video, and your controller/keyboard inputs are sent back to the server in real-time.

This could enable you to:

  • Play graphically intensive games on lower-spec devices (laptops, tablets, phones).
  • Access your game library without lengthy downloads or installations.
  • Switch seamlessly between devices.

How PWAs are Typically Accessed

Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) like Game Portal are designed to be easily accessible directly from your web browser. You can often "install" them by adding them to your device's home screen. This installation process itself is generally free and doesn't involve a traditional app store purchase for access from the web.

Monetization Strategies for Game Portal (Future Vision)

While direct paid "downloads" from the web are not standard for PWAs, there are several ways Game Portal could be monetized in the future:

1. App Store Distribution

It's possible to package PWAs for distribution through traditional app stores (e.g., Google Play Store using Trusted Web Activities - TWA, or the Microsoft Store). If Game Portal were offered through an app store:

  • It could potentially be listed as a paid app, where users pay a one-time fee to download it from the store.
  • The app store would handle the payment collection from users (who might use methods like Google Pay, credit cards, etc., as supported by the store).
  • The app store would then pay out the collected revenue (minus their commission) to the app owner's linked bank account.

2. In-App Monetization (Premium Features or Content)

Another common approach is to offer the base PWA for free, but include optional premium features, content, or subscriptions that users can purchase from within the app. Examples could include:

  • Access to exclusive games or game levels.
  • Ad-free experience.
  • Virtual currency or items.
  • Subscription for ongoing access to premium content.

Implementing this would require:

  • A secure backend system to manage user entitlements and process payments.
  • Integration with a payment processor (like Stripe, Braintree, Adyen) that can handle transactions, including those made via Google Pay or other card payments.
  • The payment processor would transfer the collected funds to the app owner's bank account.

How the App Owner Gets Paid

In either of the scenarios above (app store sales or in-app monetization), the app owner does not directly handle users' sensitive payment details like credit card numbers. Instead:

  • For app store sales, the app store manages the entire transaction and remits earnings to the owner.
  • For in-app purchases, a third-party payment processor securely handles the transaction and deposits funds to the owner.

Google Pay, in these contexts, is a payment method that users can select at the point of sale (either in the app store or within the app via the payment processor). The funds are then routed through these intermediaries before reaching the app owner.

Supporting Game Portal Now

Currently, Game Portal is a free PWA. If you'd like to support its development and growth, please see our Sponsor Us page.

Game Overview

Welcome to a journey through the vibrant and diverse cultures of Africa. Our AR game brings history, art, and tradition to life, allowing you to explore and interact with cultural artifacts in your own environment.

Core Features

  • Augmented Reality: View and interact with 3D models of African artifacts.
  • AI Storyteller: Learn about the history and significance of each artifact from our AI guide.
  • Blockchain Integration: Collect and own unique digital versions of the artifacts.
  • Cross-Platform: Experience the game on the web, mobile, and VR headsets.
  • Cultural Quests: Embark on quests to discover hidden artifacts and learn more about African cultures.

Technology Stack

This game will be built using a modern, web-first technology stack:

  • HTML5 & JavaScript: For a rich, interactive experience.
  • WebXR API: To power the augmented reality features.
  • Web3 Libraries: For seamless integration with blockchain networks.
  • Advanced AI Models: For the AI storyteller and quest generation.
